sentences.en: On October 1 st 1908, Ford Motor Corp. officially released its T - type Hardtop.
sentences.cn: 1908年10月1日福特汽车公司正式发售 T 型车.

sentences.en: Other options include xenon headlamps, a removable hardtop and GPS navigation.
sentences.cn: 其他配选配置还包含了疝气大灯 、 可硬顶篷和GPS导航系统.

sentences.en: Sadly, air conditioning, an automatic transmission and a hardtop are not currently available.
sentences.cn: 遗憾的是，你暂时还不能拥有空调，自动变速箱或者金属顶盖。

sentences.en: The car features a retractable aluminium hardtop, all - leather interior, and 18 in alloy wheels.
sentences.cn: 这款车采用了可伸缩铝硬顶, 全真皮内饰, 18合金轮毂.

sentences.en: The new product is the first hardtop coupe developed by a domestic company. Drivers of the S8 only need to press a button to quietly fold or stow away the hardtop, which only takes 25 seconds.
sentences.cn: S8是国内首款具有硬顶敞篷技术的自主轿跑车，驾驶员只要轻轻按下开关，折叠硬顶就可以自动开启或关闭，整个过程只需要25秒。

sentences.en: With no pillar behind the front door to support the roof, Pontiac coupes had a sporty, airy feel that helped popularize the style known as hardtop convertibles.
sentences.cn: 旁蒂克卡特琳娜轿跑的前门后方没有支撑车顶的支柱，这种别致的造型为这款轿跑赋予了一种了动感飘逸的感觉，这也对所谓硬顶敞篷车的流行起了推波助澜的效作用。

trans.tran_cn: 室内电影院，有金属顶盖的汽车
trans.tran_en: a car equipped with a metal or plastic roof that is sometimes detachable
